channel.title: Comments on: I finished Judaism and World Religions
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: rabbichaplain
item.dc:creator: rabbichaplain
item.description:
Mazal Tov. I look forward to the book's publication early next year.
Obviously, I'm a bit biased about your future writing endeavors as I have taken courses in both kabbalistic meditation and varieties of modern Orthodoxy with you. So I too would like to see those subjects become books, especially the one on kabbalistic meditation as I have been awaiting that for years.
In terms of the twitter question, I do think that in the long run, twitter's use is more about informing people than as a network to further conversation. I would keep to facebook and google plus for commenting purposes.
item.content:encoded:
Mazal Tov. I look forward to the book’s publication early next year.

Obviously, I’m a bit biased about your future writing endeavors as I have taken courses in both kabbalistic meditation and varieties of modern Orthodoxy with you. So I too would like to see those subjects become books, especially the one on kabbalistic meditation as I have been awaiting that for years.

In terms of the twitter question, I do think that in the long run, twitter’s use is more about informing people than as a network to further conversation. I would keep to facebook and google plus for commenting purposes.

item.title: By: Esther
item.dc:creator: Esther
item.description: Mazal Tov on finishing your book.

item.title: By: Jon
item.dc:creator: Jon
item.description:
Congratulations.
Personally none of those topics appeal to me - but if you wrote a book on modern Kabbalistic meditation practices, that would be very interesting.
item.content:encoded:
Congratulations.

Personally none of those topics appeal to me – but if you wrote a book on modern Kabbalistic meditation practices, that would be very interesting.

item.title: By: ej
item.dc:creator: ej
item.description: Congratulations on the book. I was hoping you would keep your excellent blog as is. There is something here for everybody, which would change if you concentrated on kavanot or some such subject.
item.content:encoded: Congratulations on the book. I was hoping you would keep your excellent blog as is. There is something here for everybody, which would change if you concentrated on kavanot or some such subject.

item.title: By: Jon Baker
item.dc:creator: Jon Baker
item.description:
Congratulations on finishing the book.
Re: US blog - in some respects, it's a less judgmental observer of new trends in Orthodoxy (particularly Modern) that serves as a good counterpart to Hirhurim.
item.content:encoded:
Congratulations on finishing the book.

Re: US blog – in some respects, it’s a less judgmental observer of new trends in Orthodoxy (particularly Modern) that serves as a good counterpart to Hirhurim.

item.title: By: jeffkwild
item.dc:creator: jeffkwild
item.description:
Congratulations. Does the publisher have any plans to create Kindle versions?
Also just wondering if you or any of your readers have read "What is Talmud? The Art of Disagreement," by Dolgopolski? Sounds interesting, but I was hoping for a recommendation.
item.content:encoded:
Congratulations. Does the publisher have any plans to create Kindle versions?

Also just wondering if you or any of your readers have read “What is Talmud? The Art of Disagreement,” by Dolgopolski? Sounds interesting, but I was hoping for a recommendation.

item.title: By: Arie Folger
item.dc:creator: Arie Folger
item.description:
Congratulations!
I, too, would be most interested in your next book being on Kabbalah, though Jewish-Christian issues seems interesting, too.
item.content:encoded:
Congratulations!

I, too, would be most interested in your next book being on Kabbalah, though Jewish-Christian issues seems interesting, too.

item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
Thank you for the congratulations.
Abacaxi Mamao- Sorry, indexing and book production has been outsourced to Chennai, India.
Jordan, we cant make it this week but pencil us in for July 30.
Tomer- it would be on the medieval texts. Most scholarship explains kavvanot in general. This would be on how they get scripted into tefilah- from berakhot to shema to amidah and after.
Is this a US blog? NYC has the largest group of my readers but the next city is Gush Dan. Most of the people I interview are Anglos in Israel-Buckholtz, Joshua Berman. I review Jewish studies produced in Israel. This blog does not reflect American Jewish concerns like Mah Rabu or Velveteen Rabbi. Is it American?
item.content:encoded:
Thank you for the congratulations.

Abacaxi Mamao- Sorry, indexing and book production has been outsourced to Chennai, India.

Jordan, we cant make it this week but pencil us in for July 30.

Tomer- it would be on the medieval texts. Most scholarship explains kavvanot in general. This would be on how they get scripted into tefilah- from berakhot to shema to amidah and after.

Is this a US blog? NYC has the largest group of my readers but the next city is Gush Dan. Most of the people I interview are Anglos in Israel-Buckholtz, Joshua Berman. I review Jewish studies produced in Israel. This blog does not reflect American Jewish concerns like Mah Rabu or Velveteen Rabbi. Is it American?

item.title: By: Jonathan
item.dc:creator: Jonathan
item.description: Mazel Tov on finishing your book.I would be interested and I believe there would an audience for a book about varieties of Modern Orthodoxy (as an Intellectually history of Modern Orthodoxy ).
item.content:encoded: Mazel Tov on finishing your book.I would be interested and I believe there would an audience for a book about varieties of Modern Orthodoxy (as an Intellectually history of Modern Orthodoxy ).

item.title: By: Yaakov Feldman
item.dc:creator: Yaakov Feldman
item.description: Mazal Tov on achieving a goal! Few things round us out as much as that. I look forward to the book and the soft-cover edition of the first. I personally would love you to do a lot on Kabbalah. You introduced me to R' IM Morgenstern for which I'm very grateful!
item.content:encoded:
Mazal Tov on achieving a goal! Few things round us out as much as that. I look forward to the book and the soft-cover edition of the first.
I personally would love you to do a lot on Kabbalah. You introduced me to R’ IM Morgenstern for which I’m very grateful!

item.title: By: Jordan Hirsch
item.dc:creator: Jordan Hirsch
item.description: Mazal Tov! So, when are you coming over for Shalosh Seudos? We will celebrate appropriately with Egg Creams and Tuna Fish!
item.content:encoded: Mazal Tov! So, when are you coming over for Shalosh Seudos? We will celebrate appropriately with Egg Creams and Tuna Fish!
